data.prayer: Father, please give the church in the state of Flacq prophets who can build up holiness and faithfulness to you.
data.verse: So Christ himself gave the apostles, the prophets, the evangelists, the pastors and teachers, to equip his people for works of service, so that the body of Christ may be built up

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Flacq, Mauritius
data.section_summary: What beauty can God be thanked for in this photo?

data.prayer: Father, bring yourself glory in Flacq. Through your servants plant 27 new churches that love you, love one another, and make disciples this year.
data.verse: For the earth will be filled with the knowledge of the glory of the LORD as the waters cover the sea.

data.section_summary: On average, 2 people will die without a personal relationship with Jesus in the next 100 hours in Flacq, Mauritius.
data.prayer: Lord, send your gospel to these.
Spirit, teach the church in the state of Flacq to increase their prayer for your kingdom to come.
data.verse: Now when Daniel learned that the decree had been published, he went home to his upstairs room where the windows opened toward Jerusalem. Three times a day he got down on his knees and prayed, giving thanks to his God...

data.prayer: Spirit, guide every search on Google for truth in Flacq, Mauritius to find a gospel video.
data.verse: you will seek Me and find Me when you search for Me with all your heart.

data.prayer: Lord, there are 31,473 people in the state of Flacq who claim Christianity, but may have never read the Bible. Please challenge them today to read the Bible for themselves.
data.verse: All Scripture is God-breathed and is useful for teaching, rebuking, correcting and training in righteousness

data.prayer: Spirit, build the strength and maturity of the local leaders in Flacq, Mauritius. Show them that faithfulness is better than knowledge. Show them that the Spirit, the Word, and prayer is enough in order to grow and lead.
Father, convict the 13,455 believers in Flacq to be holy and righteous. Inspire them to gather in small groups for accountability and spiritual growth.
